heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.3°C) and outside temperature (down 3.7°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 700 m) and light levels (up 7989 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 8357 lux) and cloud levels (up 663 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 700.3m lower than yesterday, 641.3m lower than the past week, 663.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 789m and a peak of 3200m, averaging 1076.7m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 1.8°C lower than yesterday, 1.3°C lower than the past week, 43.8°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday, dew point temperatures hit a low of 1.7°C and a high of 12.8°C, averaging 5.4°C; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

feels like temperature.description:
Today’s average feels like temperature is 4.3°C lower than yesterday, 3.3°C lower than the past week, 47.9°C lower than the past month.

The feels like temperatures yesterday fell between -0.3°C minimum and 19.3°C maximum, with an average of 4.1°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 7.4°C and 52.0°C.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, occasional overcast conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (94%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
